result.execSummary:
The defendant Kevin E Barnes was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Kevin E Barnes is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Kevin E Barnes was found guilty of Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).
  • Kevin E Barnes was found guilty of Possession of Cocaine/Coca(2nd+) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Court costs paid with bond posted.  Attorney fees paid in full from bond posted.

-Pay supervision fees.
-AODA assessment and follow-up.
-Absolute sobriety, no prescription drugs or illegal drugs unless prescribed and in accordance with prescription.
-Random tests.

Defendant Kevin E Barnes in court with attorney Matthew E. Weil.  Adam Yale Gerol appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a plea of guilty to counts 1 & 2.  Counts 2 & 4 dismissed.  Court finds defendant guilty of counts 1 & 2 and renders sentence.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 21, 2014 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Kevin E Barnes in court with attorney Matthew E. Weil.  Adam Yale Gerol appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Weil has received an offer from the State. Defendant advised if he does not make his attorney payments current by the next court date, Court will release the attorney.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 21, 2014 at 01:15 pm.
Further proceedings on July 16, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Kevin E Barnes in court with attorney Matthew E Weil.  Patti L Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant advised of complaint/penalties thereof. Defendant enters not guilty plea to each count. Bail to continue.  Further proceedings scheduled for July 16, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Kevin E Barnes in court with attorney Matthew E Weil.  Jeffrey A Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Officer Jerry Nye sworn and testified. Court finds probable cause and binds case over for trial. State files information. Court adjourns case for arraignment.
Preliminary hearing on May 14, 2014 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Kevin E Barnes in court with attorney Matthew E Weil.  Jeffrey A Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant advised of complaint and penalties thereof. Defendant requests preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 14, 2014 at 03:30 pm.

records.addlTxt: Status hearing on April 16, 2014 at 08:45 am.

Defendant Kevin E Barnes in court.  Adam Y. Gerol appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant stated he does not qualify for the public defender and requests court appointed counsel. Court orders defendant pay $100 per month toward attorney fees commencing 5/1/2014. Failure to pay, court will release counsel.  Status hearing scheduled for April 16, 2014 at 08:45 am.
Status hearing on April 7, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Kevin E Barnes in court with attorney .  Patti Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court advised defendant of complaint and penalties thereof. Defendant stated he needs additional time to retain counsel. Court finds good cause for extending time limits for preliminary hearing. Bail to continue. Status hearing scheduled for April 7, 2014 at 10:00 am.
w/condition: absolute sobriety, not operate m/v without valid dl, no controlled substances or prescription medication unless prescribed by physician and in conformity with said prescription.

Defendant Kevin E Barnes in court with attorney Rachel Marie Alme-Boaz.  Defendant in custody. Patti L. Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant advised of complaint and penalties thereof. Atty. Alme Boaz states she is appearing as friend of the court, defendant does not qualify for the public defender.  Court orders $3000 cash bail w/condition absolute sobriety, not operate m/v without valid dl, no controlled substances or prescription medication unless prescribed by physician and in conformity with said prescription. Court finds good cause not to schedule preliminary hearing.  Status hearing scheduled for March 12, 2014 at 10:00 am.
